And a new law, which expanded rent control around the city, told a lot of landlords they could only raise rents to about half the rate of inflation.
That was only about 1 percent that year, which was the lowest rent increase most renters had seen in over a decade.
All of the potential good things about rent control you do see going on for that initial set of renters.
